definition: difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

sentences.english: It was proved wrong to say things like that.
sentences.chinese: 已经证实那种讲法是差池的。

sentences.english: They could very well be right, if nothing in the world goes wrong.
sentences.chinese: 如果世界没出差池，他们可以过的很好。

sentences.english: Sometimes you do everything right, everything exactly right, and still you feel like you've failed.
sentences.chinese: 有时所有事都做的没错，毫无差池，却仍然有挫败感。

sentences.english: I always need to be precise. Can't afford a single centimeter's error.
sentences.chinese: 我必须让它精确无比，不能有一厘米的差池。
表面上来看没有丝毫差池。

sentences.english: And remember sometimes it is not the dream that is wrong, just the timing!
sentences.chinese: 记住，有时胡想自己并没有错，只是机会差池罢了。

sentences.english: These errors would present themselves as randomly flipped moments when certain covers were read.
sentences.chinese: 这些随机BIT差池出现在读取特定地址的时候。

sentences.english: I also fixed a zero-page protecting bug along with added minor fixes.
sentences.chinese: 我还修正了0页面寻址的BUG和一些小差池。

definition: to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
to slip/to overlook by negligence/careless omission/oversight
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
to go wrong/to get into trouble
to take a wrong turn/to go wrong
see 一著不慎，滿盤皆輸|一着不慎，满盘皆输[yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1]
